citations.narrative:
At the time of the inspection, there were 22 doves in a large enclosure with multiple eggs on the ground underneath the
perches. The previous baskets used for nests were not staying locked in place and had to be removed from the
enclosure. Due to the current reproductive needs of the species, a sufficient number of nests and materials used for
nesting must be provided to meet the needs of the breeding birds. This must be addressed for the overall health of the
birds.
Correct by: May 5, 2025
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
3.153(b)(3) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
At the time of the inspection, there were 22 doves in a large enclosure with multiple eggs on the ground underneath the 
perches. The previous baskets used for nests were not staying locked in place and had to be removed from the 
enclosure. Due to the current reproductive needs of the species, a sufficient number of nests and materials used for 
nesting must be provided to meet the needs of the breeding birds. This must be addressed for the overall health of the 
birds.  
 
Correct by: May 5, 2025 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.

species.common: BARBARY DOVE / RINGED TURTLE-DOVE / RINGNECK DOVE
